title.narrative: Continued support to displacement affected populations of the Syrian crisis

description.narrative: In Lebanon, the project will provide medium-term solutions in the form of rehabilitated housing units (2,732 housing units) and NRC's own insulated t-shelter design for formal settlements, which will be used on private property in Tripoli in groups of three maximum (30 T-shelters in total), and within Palestinian gatherings in the South (50 T-shelters). All families in shelters will receive WASH assistance. In order to mitigate the tensions due to the high concentration of refugees in some identified vulnerable areas , NRC will implement eight Community Support Projects ( 5 in the South and three in the north of the country), mainly in relation to water supply, to cope with the extra population influx and the forecasted water scarcity. The project also aims to reach a total of 154,032 beneficiaries with information, counselling and legal support, as well as providing community capacity building for refugees in urban settings.
